By constructing a causal definition for morality it goes beyond Kant's [[categorical imperative]] to explain ‘why’ morality. It understands the moral question as a clash of interests (individual's interest with someone else's superior interest) in the mind of an individual endowed with internal conflicting pulls on his choice.
